729704f-a.text:
Stewart Avenue, east side, 10: yards south of Watchogue Road, showing the old Vreeland House. Before Stewart Avenue was laid out the entrance to the house and farm was from
Watchogue Road.
About 1900
By Eugene G. Putnam
From Staten Island Museum Collection through P. L. Sperr
729704f-a.folder: Stewart Avenue & Watchogue Road, Staten Island, NY

729883f.text:
Pero-Christopher House, 441 Watchogue Avenue, n.w. cor. Stewart Avenue, Staten Island. Hts stone walls
are two feet thick.
n.d.
Acquired from the New York Herald Iribune sorgue,
1948. 48(482
729883f.folder: Watchogue Road & Stewart Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729884f-b.text:
(1)
441 atchomue Road, adjoininm the N.W. corner of Stewart Avenue (formerly Willowhrook Road), showing the Pero House, dating back to colonial times. The house derives its name from Peter Pero, who distinguished himself i the Civil War. The property was boucht by Garret Cruser in 1739; Daniel Winant owned it in 1839; Ailliam H. Pero boummt it in 1878. It is
also referred to as the Pero Christophr House.
Jure 18, 1938.
P.L. Sperr
(2)
Another view, a cross Wotchogue Road.
June 18, 1938.
P.L. Sperr
729884f-b.folder: Watchogue Road & Stewart Avenue, Staten Island, NY
